cities.name: Madrid
cities.description: Madrid, the capital of Spain, is a dynamic city renowned for its rich cultural heritage, stunning architecture, and vibrant atmosphere. From iconic landmarks like the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor to world-class museums such as the Prado, Madrid offers a captivating blend of history, art, and modernity. With its bustling streets, delicious cuisine, and lively nightlife, Madrid invites visitors to immerse themselves in the heart of Spanish culture and experience its unique charm.

cities.name: Berlin
cities.description: The German capital is also home to all the major government buildings, including the historic Reichstag, the seat of the German parliament. Berlin is the city of arts, artists and museums. More than 170 museums, including the world-famous Museum Island, showcase the world's treasures.

cities.name: Amsterdam
cities.description: Amsterdam is much more than the stereotypes that are presented of this city on postcards. The first capitalism and the golden age of modern art flourished here. That wealth and art has been preserved over the years until now, making Amsterdam one of the main tourist cities in all of Europe.

cities.name: Athens
cities.description: Athens, Greece's historic capital, blends ancient marvels like the Acropolis with modern charm. Its labyrinthine streets in the Plaka neighborhood offer a taste of local life, while the bustling Monastiraki district provides a vibrant atmosphere. With its rich history and vibrant culture, Athens beckons visitors to explore its timeless allure.

cities.name: Edinburgh
cities.description: Scotland's capital is one of the most unique and memorable cities in Europe. Studded with volcanic hills it sits on the southern shore of the Firth of Forth. The cities superb architecture ranges from the Greek-style monuments found on Calton Hill, to extraordinary 16th century tenements in the Old Town.

cities.name: Brussels
cities.description: Currently Belgium is also the headquarters of the European institutions and NATO. It is the comic capital of the world and the country of waffles and fries. Beyond the clich√©s that may be said, Belgium is not a country recognized especially for its gastronomy, nor for its festivals.But it is a place where you can find a huge cultural offer next to cities of great beauty such as Ghent, Bruges, or Antwerp.

activities.name: Guernica at Museo Reina Sofia
activities.description: With this painting is the opposite of the Mona Lisa in the Louvre in Paris, with Guernica you are surprised by how huge it is and that there is not a huge crowd of people trying to see it.

location.address: C. de Sta. Isabel, 52, Centro, 28012 Madrid

activities.name: Tapas at El Tigre
activities.description: Located in the heart of Chueca, this simple bar has become one of the most typical tapas bars when going out for a drink in the area. Far from the sophisticated and modern aesthetics of many of its neighboring establishments, it is very busy every day and especially on weekends, when all kinds of customers come attracted by the great tapas offered with each drink, ranging from potato omelettes to portions of rice, pork shoulder or chorizo.

location.address: C. de las Infantas, 23, Centro, 28004 Madrid

activities.name: Clubbing at Teatro Barcel√≥
activities.description: Teatro Barcel√≥ is a renowned nightclub nestled in the heart of Madrid, Spain, celebrated for its vibrant ambiance, diverse music selection, and energetic atmosphere. This iconic venue attracts party-goers from all over with its multiple floors, each offering a distinct musical vibe, from electronic beats to hip-hop rhythms. With its central location and reputation for lively nights, Club Barcel√≥ promises unforgettable experiences for those seeking to immerse themselves in Madrid's dynamic nightlife scene.

activities.name: Tour the Nuevo Bernab√©u Stadium
activities.description: The Nuevo Bernab√©u is the updated and renovated version of the historic Santiago Bernab√©u Stadium, home to the famous Real Madrid football club. This modernized stadium features state-of-the-art facilities, enhanced spectator experiences, and improved amenities for fans. With its iconic design and world-class facilities, the Nuevo Bernab√©u stands as a symbol of Real Madrid's enduring legacy and commitment to excellence in football.

location.address: Av. de Concha Espina, 1, Chamart√≠n, 28036 Madrid

activities.name: Attend the Mad Cool Festival
activities.description: The Mad Cool Festival in Madrid is a renowned annual music event featuring diverse genres and international artists. With multiple stages and a vibrant atmosphere, it draws a global audience for an unforgettable experience.

activities.name: Walk through el Retiro Park
activities.description: Retiro Park in Madrid is a beloved urban oasis, offering tranquility and natural beauty in the heart of the city. With its lush greenery, scenic pathways, and iconic landmarks like the Crystal Palace, it's a popular destination for locals and visitors alike. Whether strolling along the tree-lined avenues, rowing on the serene lake, or simply relaxing amidst the peaceful surroundings, Retiro Park provides a refreshing escape from the hustle and bustle of Madrid's urban life.

activities.name: Explore a diverse gastronomy at the San Miguel Market
activities.description: The San Miguel Market in Madrid is a bustling culinary hotspot, housed in a historic glass-and-iron structure. Here, visitors can savor a diverse array of gourmet delights, from traditional Spanish tapas to international cuisine, amidst a lively atmosphere that captures the essence of Madrid's vibrant food culture.

location.address: Pl. de San Miguel, s/n, Centro, 28005 Madrid

activities.name: Immerse in Madrid's nocturnal charm at Caf√© Berlin
activities.description: Caf√© Berlin in Madrid is a popular cultural venue, known for its lively ambiance and diverse entertainment offerings. Located in the heart of the city, it serves as a hub for live music, comedy shows, and artistic events, attracting a diverse crowd of locals and tourists alike. Whether you're enjoying a drink with friends or catching a live performance, Caf√© Berlin offers a dynamic and welcoming atmosphere that embodies the vibrant spirit of Madrid's cultural scene.

activities.name: Go Trekking through Navacerrada
activities.description: Trekking through Navacerrada offers outdoor enthusiasts an exhilarating journey into the Sierra de Guadarrama mountains. With scenic trails and breathtaking vistas, it's an ideal retreat to reconnect with nature's beauty and tranquility.

activities.name: Experience Noches del Bot√°nico: Music Under the Stars
activities.description: Noches del Bot√°nico in Madrid is a summer highlight, where the botanical garden hosts captivating outdoor concerts. Featuring an eclectic lineup spanning jazz, blues, rock, and world music, it promises unforgettable experiences for music enthusiasts seeking unique performances amidst lush surroundings and a magical ambiance.

location.address: Av. Complutense, s/n, Moncloa - Aravaca, 28040 Madrid

activities.name: Mustafas Gem√ºse Kebab
activities.description: If you have not tried Mustafas Gem√ºse Kebab then you don‚Äôt know just how awesome a freshly prepared Kebab can taste like. If you only have time to try one Kebab then make sure you head out to Kreuzberg and give Mustafas a try

activities.name: Oktoberfest Berl√≠n
activities.description: The traditional Oktoberfest in Berlin will not only feature a large 80 x 20 meter Paulaner tent, with Bavarian style decoration and furniture, but also a large party and a fair with many attractions. And, of course, lots of the best beer!

activities.name: East side Gallery
activities.description: At 1316 metres long, the open-air art gallery on the banks of the Spree in Friedrichshain is the longest continuous section of the Berlin Wall still in existence. Immediately after the wall came down on 9 November 1989, 118 artists from 21 countries began painting the East Side Gallery, and it officially opened as an open air gallery on 28 September 1990. Just over a year later, it was given protected memorial status.

activities.name: Tiergarten Berlin
activities.description: Berlin's Tiergarten is the equivalent of New York's Central Park or London's Hyde Park: the green lung of the metropolis. Located in the city center, close to tourist attractions such as the Brandenburg Gate, it is, with its 210 meters, larger than London's Hyde Park. This park is a meeting point for walks, family picnics, playing ball or simply resting for a while. In summer, every Sunday you can hear the carillon bells.

activities.name: Eastside Music Days
activities.description: East Side Music Days is Berlin‚Äôs first street music festival, which premiered in 2015. This public festival around East Side Park and the Oberbaumbr√ºcke is dedicated to Berlin artists who have used the street as a stage on their way to a professional career. Nearly 100 solo artists and bands performed on various stages along the banks of the Spree and presented a diverse programme of different genres ‚Äì from jazz, funk and soul to reggae, ska, hip-hop, pop and electronica.

activities.name: Musikfest Berlin
activities.description: Three weeks with internationally renowned orchestras, conductors, conductors and soloists, exciting new music and a look beyond the familiar cultural territory: that is Musikfest Berlin, organized by the Berlin Festivals in cooperation with the Berliner Philharmoniker Foundation.

activities.name: Tresor Club
activities.description: How do we best describe Tresor? Well... get ready for hard techno beats, pounding sensations, and DJs behind jail bars in this iconic techno underground club. Located in an abandoned power plant, you'll experience one of the best techno clubs in Berlin in Tresor.

activities.name: The Bulldog The First Coffeeshop
activities.description: The Bulldog is a very famous Coffeeshop chain in Amsterdam that has 5 locations, a hotel, several gift shops and seed shops. Popular with tourists and locals, The Bulldog is easily recognizable by its logo: the mastiff with the studded collar.

activities.name: Anne Frank house museum
activities.description: The Anne Frank House is a museum with a story As a visitor, you will experience this history through quotes, photos, films and original objects.

location.address: Anne Frank House Westermarkt 20, 1016 DK Amsterdam

activities.name: Arcadia Restaurant
activities.description: Arcadia Restaurant in Athens is a chic restaurant in front of the acr√≥polis of athens offering a fusion of Mediterranean and international cuisine. With a stylish ambiance adorned with jazz motifs, patrons can enjoy a diverse menu featuring Greek specialties, seafood, and gourmet pasta dishes,

activities.name: Guided Acropolis Tour with Fast Track Tickets
activities.description: The Acropolis of Athens can be considered the most representative of the Greek acropolis. The acropolis was, literally, the upper city and was present in most Greek cities, with a dual function: defensive and as the seat of the main places of worship.

activities.name: Dollar: Discover canyoning near Edinburgh
activities.description: Discover the thrill of canyoneering on an excursion to Dollar Glen. Learn all the skills you need from qualified guides, then jump, slide, zip line, climb and rappel down waterfalls and green countryside.

location.address: 20 Castle Rd, Dollar FK14 7PP, Reino Unido

activities.name: Edinburgh Castle: Guided Walking Tour with Entry Ticket
activities.description: Explore one of the most important fortresses in Scottish history with this entrance ticket to Edinburgh Castle. Visit the Great Hall and delve into the castle's action-packed past on a guided walking tour.

activities.name: Entrance to the Atomium with a Design Museum ticket
activities.description: Visit an icon of Brussels and Belgium and a unique creation of architectural history. The iconic relic of the 1958 Brussels International Exhibition, the Atomium is the European capital's most popular attraction.

activities.name: Visit to the Chocolate Museum with workshop
activities.description: Enjoy making your own personalized chocolate bars with the help of a professional chocolatier. After the workshop, you can visit the Choco-Story museum in Brussels with an audio guide.

activities.name: Supermercado Dia
activities.description: Go shopping!
